name: 1,6-diaminohexane
Reason: The base unit for comparison is hexane, which has a melting point around -95°C. Adding functional groups to hexane can increase the melting point. Each amine group in 1,6-diaminohexane can form hydrogen bonds, which substantially raises the melting point. The effect of an amine group on the melting point can be estimated to be around +65°C to +75°C. Since there are two amine groups in 1,6-diaminohexane, we can calculate the effect as two times this value.
Prediction: Adding the effect of two amine groups to the base value of hexane: -95 + 2*(65 to 75) = 35°C to 55°C
